author: danfinlay
content: Yes, the more evm-json-rpc chains there are, the more variation between them, and wallets/clients need to be able to distinguish between them in the ways they vary. One very simple method that could satisfy this requirement might be an `eth_getBaseFeeStartBlock()` rpc method, which could return the block (past or present) that the 1559-type fee structure begins, so the wallet/clients could behave accordingly, regardless of whether this is mainnet, Optimism, Rinkeby, or something else.
